commit_message:
Configurable external gateway modes

Blueprint l3-ext-gw-modes

This patch introduces an API extension for enabling or disabling
source/destination NAT on the router gateway interface, and implements
support for this extension in the l3 agent, which has also been
refactored in order to ensure SNAT rules are applied (or removed)
in a single place in the process_router routine.
The patch therefore enables the extension on all plugins which
leverage this agent.
In this patch the validate_boolean function is re-introduced, as it
used for validating a field of the external_gateway_info dict.
The resource extension process is also slightly changed so that an
API extension can specify which extension should be processed before
its attributes can be processed. This is needed to ensure the
proper validator for external_gateway_info is installed.

Change-Id: Ia80cb56135229366b1706dd3c6d366e40cde1500

commit_message:
Support for NFS shares with spaces in path.

Unescape share address string listed in nfs_shares_config so that
'x.y.z.w:/foo\040bar' would become 'x.y.z.w:/foo bar' to support
mounting shares with spaces in name.
Use stat command to get available and total space on device instead
of df since it's output is easier to parse.

Fixes: bug #1180984
Change-Id: I552aba91ca8db14130f854c739594a818186bbe2

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-05-29 16:23:55.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_fc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/test_hp3par.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py'], 'message': 'Fixes 3PAR Host already exists error.

Fixed “Host already exists” error by,
* Screen scraping error message and extracting the host name
used by the 3PAR backend.
* Cache the host name used by the 3PAR backend for subsequent
methods using host name.
* After a restart, and 3PAR host name it no longer available,
retrieve 3PAR host name using wwn/iqn, if a terminate_connection
fails.

Fixes bug 1182134

Change-Id: Ia08a311af168ae19dbe7c1405db9c606fd878e53
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes 3PAR Host already exists error.

Fixed “Host already exists” error by,
* Screen scraping error message and extracting the host name
used by the 3PAR backend.
* Cache the host name used by the 3PAR backend for subsequent
methods using host name.
* After a restart, and 3PAR host name it no longer available,
retrieve 3PAR host name using wwn/iqn, if a terminate_connection
fails.

Fixes bug 1182134

Change-Id: Ia08a311af168ae19dbe7c1405db9c606fd878e53

subject: Call os.kill for each child instead of the process group
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-06 08:57:01.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/wsgi.py'], 'message': "Call os.kill for each child instead of the process group

The patch sets the process group id to its process id. Note that this
change raises an OSError in Glance's tests because they are run under
Popen and using glance-control, which changes children's session ids and
other parameters. That for, setpgid is inside a try / except and falls
back to 0.

Fixes bug 1068051

NOTE: This issue is not affecting production/stable environments (no comments
related to that have been made) but the issue is there and raises under
certain cases.

The backport is being suggested because this is, most likely, happening
under the hoods without users even noticing it.

Change-Id: Ie9ed044e08053d0067396138de0bd124326aa1a5
Cherry-picked: a9f9f137bb44bd5727854f416f8b0c7c3df81867
"}]
commit_message:
Call os.kill for each child instead of the process group

The patch sets the process group id to its process id. Note that this
change raises an OSError in Glance's tests because they are run under
Popen and using glance-control, which changes children's session ids and
other parameters. That for, setpgid is inside a try / except and falls
back to 0.

Fixes bug 1068051

NOTE: This issue is not affecting production/stable environments (no comments
related to that have been made) but the issue is there and raises under
certain cases.

The backport is being suggested because this is, most likely, happening
under the hoods without users even noticing it.

Change-Id: Ie9ed044e08053d0067396138de0bd124326aa1a5
Cherry-picked: a9f9f137bb44bd5727854f416f8b0c7c3df81867

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-05-14 12:00:06.000000000', 'files': ['swift/container/server.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'etc/proxy-server.conf-sample', 'test/unit/common/ring/test_ring.py', 'swift/account/server.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/account.py', 'swift/common/ring/ring.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/container.py', 'swift/proxy/server.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': "Implementation of proxy affinity for requests.

* Configurable parameter region was added in proxy-server
  configuration file.
* New configurable algorithm for iter_nodes function generate nodes
  according to following variants:
    - only local nodes;
    - local nodes and then remote nodes;
    - default behavior.
* Implementation get_local_nodes function for collecting local nodes
  equal by number of replicas.
* Get_nodes was replacement by get_local_nodes with parameter regions
  in some places of code.
* Using configurable iter_nodes for some requests according to proxy
  affinity implementation.
* Add header 'x-auto-create-on-handoff' for PUT and DELETE at handoffs
  nodes.
* Proxy affinity for PUT, GET, HEAD, POST, DELETE requests for
  account-, container-, object- servers for region architecture.

Change-Id: I4067b64e68b3db4a0e5dfa532d81dbec415edb6e
Implements: blueprint proxy-affinity
Implements: blueprint proxy-affinity-writes
Implements: blueprint multi-region
"}]
commit_message:
Implementation of proxy affinity for requests.

* Configurable parameter region was added in proxy-server
  configuration file.
* New configurable algorithm for iter_nodes function generate nodes
  according to following variants:
    - only local nodes;
    - local nodes and then remote nodes;
    - default behavior.
* Implementation get_local_nodes function for collecting local nodes
  equal by number of replicas.
* Get_nodes was replacement by get_local_nodes with parameter regions
  in some places of code.
* Using configurable iter_nodes for some requests according to proxy
  affinity implementation.
* Add header 'x-auto-create-on-handoff' for PUT and DELETE at handoffs
  nodes.
* Proxy affinity for PUT, GET, HEAD, POST, DELETE requests for
  account-, container-, object- servers for region architecture.

Change-Id: I4067b64e68b3db4a0e5dfa532d81dbec415edb6e
Implements: blueprint proxy-affinity
Implements: blueprint proxy-affinity-writes
Implements: blueprint multi-region

subject: Don't raise HTTPForbidden on a multitenant environment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-06 07:28:27.000000000', 'files': ['glance/store/swift.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_swift_store.py'], 'message': "Don't raise HTTPForbidden on a multitenant environment

When getting public images in a multi-tenant environment, Swift raises
HTTPForbidden for chuncked images.

Based on swift documentation, rlistings directive turns listings on,
which is the desired behavior in this case.

Fixes bug 1170156

NOTE: Swift guys where consulted about this fix.

Change-Id: I149f702d5b3ebae73b04deed4809939ab43c6adc
Cherry-picked: 2d492e04be9e386e402ddde248d9a55c8d04a2bb
"}]
commit_message:
Don't raise HTTPForbidden on a multitenant environment

When getting public images in a multi-tenant environment, Swift raises
HTTPForbidden for chuncked images.

Based on swift documentation, rlistings directive turns listings on,
which is the desired behavior in this case.

Fixes bug 1170156

NOTE: Swift guys where consulted about this fix.

Change-Id: I149f702d5b3ebae73b04deed4809939ab43c6adc
Cherry-picked: 2d492e04be9e386e402ddde248d9a55c8d04a2bb

subject: Call monkey_patch before other modules are loaded
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-06 08:52:19.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/wsgi.py', 'bin/glance-registry', 'glance/tests/unit/test_wsgi.py', 'bin/glance-api'], 'message': 'Call monkey_patch before other modules are loaded

This patch moves the monkey_patch call into the glance scripts that
needs libs to be monkey_patched. This seems to be a good practice and
has given good results for other projects as well.

This change is needed  to avoid loading / initializing modules
before other libs are patched. For example: logging module.

Fixes bug 1163722

Change-Id: Idee486851606d765fb11598967a4f7d56cf46c97
Cherry-picked: 1c5a4d2bdcc00439b5e351d14f47deebdedcb001
'}]
commit_message:
Call monkey_patch before other modules are loaded

This patch moves the monkey_patch call into the glance scripts that
needs libs to be monkey_patched. This seems to be a good practice and
has given good results for other projects as well.

This change is needed  to avoid loading / initializing modules
before other libs are patched. For example: logging module.

Fixes bug 1163722

Change-Id: Idee486851606d765fb11598967a4f7d56cf46c97
Cherry-picked: 1c5a4d2bdcc00439b5e351d14f47deebdedcb001

commit_message:
engine : PoC initial template_format parser for HOT template

Based on the draft templates posted, this is a super-minimal example of
where we can plug in the DSL/HOT translator in a non-intrusive way.
Initially the translation will be from HOT to our internal template
model, and over time, we could potentially use a similar _parse_cfn
function to somewhat de-aws-ify the engine

provides a starting point for blueprint: hot-hello-world

Change-Id: I7ed48dfa8037f7058883afa6a911927ca808f5bb

subject: Don't delete sys_meta on instance delete
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-29 21:48:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_utils.py', 'nova/tests/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Don't delete sys_meta on instance delete

Unfortunately, we require to access instance_system_metadata to get
data (specifically at least instance_type data) for instances that have
been deleted.

There's 2 cases where this is true:

1) nova-api supports showing deleting instances when you specify a
'changes-since' param.
2) The _usage_audit_log periodic task pulls all instances during the
audit period, which includes instances that have been deleted during
that period.

This reverts commit 17bca438954638d74035d560e826a26a532b3ea3, which was
attempting to fix a bug where we leave instance_system_metadata entries
undeleted from the DB.  There's not an easy way to query for the deleted
sys_meta data in an efficient manner, and leaving the entries undeleted is
the lesser of the 2 evils for now.

Fixes bug 1185190

Change-Id: I898f0546c49126dcc56a4237120082f95dc82304
(cherry picked from commit 4885aa28706a1858f4fc51a0d2c661eec05139c0)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't delete sys_meta on instance delete

Unfortunately, we require to access instance_system_metadata to get
data (specifically at least instance_type data) for instances that have
been deleted.

There's 2 cases where this is true:

1) nova-api supports showing deleting instances when you specify a
'changes-since' param.
2) The _usage_audit_log periodic task pulls all instances during the
audit period, which includes instances that have been deleted during
that period.

This reverts commit 17bca438954638d74035d560e826a26a532b3ea3, which was
attempting to fix a bug where we leave instance_system_metadata entries
undeleted from the DB.  There's not an easy way to query for the deleted
sys_meta data in an efficient manner, and leaving the entries undeleted is
the lesser of the 2 evils for now.

Fixes bug 1185190

Change-Id: I898f0546c49126dcc56a4237120082f95dc82304
(cherry picked from commit 4885aa28706a1858f4fc51a0d2c661eec05139c0)

commit_message:
Remove character causing knife cookbook upload to fail.

This mystery character causes knife cookbook upload to fail with ../ruby-1.9.3-p429/gems/chef-11.4.4/lib/chef/cookbook/metadata.rb:444:in `encode\': "\xE2" on US-ASCII (Encoding::InvalidByteSequenceError). Whatever it is gets rolled up when the metadata.rb imports the README.md in the long_description.

Change-Id: I13cd55bee3a98ac0bb0a50abc4e3fef2d61120ba

subject: Clean up DB migrations when running unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-29 07:41:46.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': 'Clean up DB migrations when running unit tests

When doing development work, all kinds of issue can result when moving
between versions of the code that have added/removed DB migration scripts
if the compiled .pyc files are left behind. To save the need to do this
manually, remove all of the .pyc files when the unit tests are run.

Change-Id: Ia4bc889edeeed499e5fc2172d5f7c1b4e693a27b
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up DB migrations when running unit tests

When doing development work, all kinds of issue can result when moving
between versions of the code that have added/removed DB migration scripts
if the compiled .pyc files are left behind. To save the need to do this
manually, remove all of the .pyc files when the unit tests are run.

Change-Id: Ia4bc889edeeed499e5fc2172d5f7c1b4e693a27b

subject: horizon should default to internalURL in 'url_for' function
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-05-14 17:07:35.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/api/base.py', 'horizon/tests/api_tests/base_tests.py', 'horizon/test.py'], 'message': "horizon should default to internalURL in 'url_for' function

All of the horizon client API modules, except for keystone, default to
using the publicURL value from the service catalog when looking up url
values.  There are use cases where the publicURL is not exposed or
defined, but leaving publicURL undefined causes some critical operations
to fail.

The horizon keystone client defaults to internalURL, which should be
the rule for all horizon intra-service communications.

Fixes Bug:  #1178690

Change-Id: Ia2f2bf0ce93b865dd9a1954fcdd3711089782671
"}]
commit_message:
horizon should default to internalURL in 'url_for' function

All of the horizon client API modules, except for keystone, default to
using the publicURL value from the service catalog when looking up url
values.  There are use cases where the publicURL is not exposed or
defined, but leaving publicURL undefined causes some critical operations
to fail.

The horizon keystone client defaults to internalURL, which should be
the rule for all horizon intra-service communications.

Fixes Bug:  #1178690

Change-Id: Ia2f2bf0ce93b865dd9a1954fcdd3711089782671

commit_message:
Monitoring for mute child cells

Adds a config option: child_cell_timeout

If a child cell does not notify its parent about capacities or
capabilities in 'child_cell_timeout' seconds, the parent cell will
publish a notification and stop sending builds to that cell until it
hears from it again.

Adds some extra tests to CellsStateManager.

Fixes bug 1174726

Change-Id: I6fb9b56c52620d2bc73279afd00a7c5f24dfb4b7

commit_message:
python3: Add compat layer for python2/python3

Add a compatibility module that provides a useful
abstraction layer over the differences between
different python versions.

This is based off of python-webob which has its
own compatibility layer. This removes the need
for openstack projects to depend on python-six
for compatibility.

Change-Id: Ia9a081fc670e27db0b7b2d0c9b50baf409ce7268
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

subject: Flavor's function show() should not include those deleted flavors.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-14 13:45:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_flavor_manage.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_flavorextradata.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/test_flavors.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_flavor_rxtx.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_flavor_access.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/flavors.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_flavor_disabled.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_flavor_swap.py'], 'message': 'Flavor's function show() should not include those deleted flavors.

There is a bug in nova client. Suppose we have two flavors A and B,
where A's name = <name>, B's id = <id> and <name> = <id>, and flavor
A exists while flavor B has been deleted before.

Because the flavor function show() will get B by id, when running
"nova flavor-delete <name>" to delete A, find_resource() in utils.py
will get B, deleting B again will cause an exception.
However, the flavor A is not deleted, which isn't expected.

Change-Id: I73789b336c52e66dd49592b9562f70a86cde6d5b
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Flavor's function show() should not include those deleted flavors.

There is a bug in nova client. Suppose we have two flavors A and B,
where A's name = <name>, B's id = <id> and <name> = <id>, and flavor
A exists while flavor B has been deleted before.

Because the flavor function show() will get B by id, when running
"nova flavor-delete <name>" to delete A, find_resource() in utils.py
will get B, deleting B again will cause an exception.
However, the flavor A is not deleted, which isn't expected.

Change-Id: I73789b336c52e66dd49592b9562f70a86cde6d5b
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2013-05-16 18:46:01.000000000', 'files': ['tests/default_fixtures.py', 'keystone/token/controllers.py', 'keystone/common/controller.py', 'tests/test_backend.py', 'tests/test_content_types.py', 'etc/policy.json'], 'message': 'Move auth_token middleware from admin user to an RBAC policy

Before this patch auth_token middleware required admin user credentials
stored in assorted config files. With this patch only non-admin user
credentials are needed. The revocation_list and validate_token commands
use an policy.json rule, to only allow these commands if you are in have the
service role.

Rule used:
    "service_role": [["role:service"]],
    "service_or_admin": [["rule:admin_required"], ["rule:service_role"]],

Added the policy wrapper on the validate functions.

Fixes bug 1153789

Change-Id: I43986e26b16aa5213ad2536a0d07d942bf3dbbbb
'}]
commit_message:
Move auth_token middleware from admin user to an RBAC policy

Before this patch auth_token middleware required admin user credentials
stored in assorted config files. With this patch only non-admin user
credentials are needed. The revocation_list and validate_token commands
use an policy.json rule, to only allow these commands if you are in have the
service role.

Rule used:
    "service_role": [["role:service"]],
    "service_or_admin": [["rule:admin_required"], ["rule:service_role"]],

Added the policy wrapper on the validate functions.

Fixes bug 1153789

Change-Id: I43986e26b16aa5213ad2536a0d07d942bf3dbbbb

subject: Move autoscaling metrics from nodes to broker.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-30 02:41:48.000000000', 'files': ['openshift-origin/OpenShiftAutoScaling.yaml'], 'message': 'Move autoscaling metrics from nodes to broker.

Broker has scripts /etc/heat/notify-scale-up and /etc/heat/notify-scale-down
which will trigger heat autoscaling.

Scaling decisions will be made within the broker itself using its own
platform agnostic scaling scripts:
https://github.com/openshift/openshift-extras/tree/enterprise-1.1/node-manager

This template has successfully scaled up from 1 to 3 nodes, and scaled back
down to 1 by manually executing notify-scale-up and notify-scale-down.

Change-Id: Idb9920438bbe598b610efc8eca5bc158181b74a7
'}]
commit_message:
Move autoscaling metrics from nodes to broker.

Broker has scripts /etc/heat/notify-scale-up and /etc/heat/notify-scale-down
which will trigger heat autoscaling.

Scaling decisions will be made within the broker itself using its own
platform agnostic scaling scripts:
https://github.com/openshift/openshift-extras/tree/enterprise-1.1/node-manager

This template has successfully scaled up from 1 to 3 nodes, and scaled back
down to 1 by manually executing notify-scale-up and notify-scale-down.

Change-Id: Idb9920438bbe598b610efc8eca5bc158181b74a7

commit_message:
Add node as instance attribute for notification

Fix bug 1181900

In havana release, node is not set as instance attribute and node
indicates the hypervisor where the instance reside in, we should
set node as instance attribute for notification.

Change-Id: I872fba626ef3e321d88cf60fc730df6cf4612c86

commit_message:
Fix colorizier thowing exception when a test fails

This failure in colorizier was hidding the actual error
in the tests. If we ran enough tests it also became difficult
to see which test had actually failed.

Fixes: bug 1183602

Change-Id: I806da8f13040b38258de7f3e0fa7b62700bdcead

commit_message:
No relevant message when stop a stopped VM

When user tries to stop a stopped VM, there is no need to stop it again,
and We need return it's vm_state.

Fixes bug 1181934

commit_message:
Add base object model

This adds the base infrastructure for a unified object model in
Nova. It provides a somewhat-magical metaclass which serves to
automatically register objects that are capable of being remoted.
Magic remoting of methods happens via two decorators, allowing
a given nova service to globally declare that such actions should
happen over RPC to avoid DB accesses.

For more details, see blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: Iecd54ca22666f730c41d2278f74b86d922624a4e
